Description:
The FHIR Patient resource defines demographics, care providers, and other administrative information about a person receiving care at a health organization. The Patient.Create web service creates a new patient record or returns an existing one:

  • If a single high-threshold match is found in the target environment based on Identity IDs or demographics, the service returns the existing patient.
  • If a match is found in external EMPI, the service creates a shell patient in the target environment and returns it.
  • If no match is found, the service creates a net new patient in the target environment.
SampleRequest:
https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/R4/Patient/

<Patient>

<identifier>

<use value="usual" />

<system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.5.737384.27000" />

<value value="8512" />

</identifier>

<identifier>

<use value="usual" />

<system value="urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.4.1" />

<value value="484-76-1291" />

</identifier>

<name>

<use value="usual" />

<family value="Lufhir" />

<given value="Sakiko" />

<suffix value="JR." />

</name>

<telecom>

<system value="phone" />

<value value="321-544-1111" />

<use value="home" />

</telecom>

<telecom>

<system value="email" />

<value value="sakikolu.fhir@gmail.com" />

</telecom>

<gender value="F" />

<birthDate value="1994-07-22" />

<address>

<use value="home" />

<line value="100 Milky Way" />

<line value="Learning Campus" />

<city value="Verona" />

<state value="WI" />

<postalCode value="53593" />

<country value="USA" />

</address>

<maritalStatus>

<text value="Single" />

</maritalStatus>

<generalPractitioner>

<display value="Amber Hxl, MD" />

<reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/R4/Practitioner/efv90i4pFs9fOm7QQhHOUHw3" />

</generalPractitioner>

<extension>

<url value="http://open.epic.com/FHIR/R4/StructureDefinition/patient-preferred-provider-language" />

<valueCodeableConcept>

<coding>

<system value="urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.99" />

<code value="ja" />

</coding>

<text value="Japanese" />

</valueCodeableConcept>

</extension>

<extension>

<url value="http://open.epic.com/FHIR/R4/StructureDefinition/patient-preferred-provider-sex" />

<valueCode value="F" />

</extension>

<extension url="http://open.epic.com/FHIR/StructureDefinition/extension/birth-location">

<valueReference>

<reference value="Location/egBUpeeV7ngRNGZSju06yw3" />

<display value="70 Harbor Bluff North" />

<valueReference>

<extension url="http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/patient-genderIdentity">

<valueCodeableConcept>

<coding>

<system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.5325.1.7.10.698084.131.657370.1194" />

<code value="female" />

</coding>

</valueCodeableConcept>

</extension>

</Patient>
SampleResponse:
HTTP/1.1 201 Created

Cache-Control: no-cache

Pragma: no-cache

Content-Type: application/xml; charset=utf-8

Expires: -1

Location: https://weiyuwashere/iminatable/api/FHIR/R4/Patient/exDSwojzEZ227cjTU-I4v22vKFEf9k5DyqqaTBImr7983

Server: Microsoft-IIS/8.5

X-AspNet-Version: 4.0.30319

X-Powered-By: ASP.NET

Date: Wed, 21 Mar 2018 20:24:42 GMT

Content-Length: 0

active.Name: active
active.Description:
Whether the patient record is active.

This is always True. We don't support creating inactive patients.

birth location.Name: extension
birth location.Description: The newborn’s birth facility ID, name, address, and phone number.

birthDate.Name: birthDate
birthDate.Description: The patient's date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
birthDate.Optional: May or may not be required depending on the system.

gender.Name: gender
gender.Optional: May or may not be required depending on the system.

gender-identity.Name: extension
gender-identity.Description: The patient’s gender identity.   Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

generalPractitioner.Name: generalPractitioner
generalPractitioner.Description: The patient's Primary Care Provider (PCP). Reference to a Practitioner resource.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: Unique IDs assigned to the patient. Can include SSN and Identity IDs.

name.Name: name
name.Description:
The patient's name.

  • Starting in the May 2020 version of Epic, this element includes both the patient's "official" name, which is the patient's legal name, and the patient's "usual" name, which is the patient's preferred name.
    • If the patient does not have a preferred name defined in your system, the "usual" name also holds the patient's legal name.
    • In a patient-facing context, this web service always shows the patient's preferred name, unless a user has the security point 'Only Show Legal Name'.
  • In February 2020 and earlier, this element returns only the patient's legal name with a use code of "usual".

given.Name: given
given.Description: The patient's given name. May include first and middle names.

text.Name: text
text.Description: The patient's full name as a string.

use.Name: use
use.Description: The purpose of the name. May be "legal" or "usual". See the name parameter for full details on use.

patient-preferred-provider-language.Name: extension
patient-preferred-provider-language.Description: The patient's preferred provider language, used for scheduling.

patient-preferred-provider-sex.Name: extension
patient-preferred-provider-sex.Description: The patient's preferred provider sex, used for scheduling.

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: Telephone numbers and email addresses for the patient, along with their use (i.e. home, work, etc.)

system.Name: system
system.Description:
The type of telecom. Potential values are:

  • email
  • phone

use.Name: use
use.Description:
If the telecom entry is a phone number, possible values are:

  • home
  • mobile
  • work

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the telecom method. May be an email address or phone number.

Patient.Name: Patient
Patient.Description: A single instance of a Patient FHIR resource.
